verse_reference: Albert Camus - "What is absurd is the confrontation between the irrational and the desperate longing for clarity whose call echoes in the human heart."
Albert Camus - "The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion."
Albert Camus - "In the midst of winter, I found there was, within me, an invincible summer."
Albert Camus - "Life is the sum of all your choices."
Albert Einstein - "Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will live its whole life believing that it is stupid."
Albert Einstein - "Imagination is more important than knowledge."
Albert Einstein - "Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value."
Albert Einstein - "Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving."
Ambrose Redmoon - "Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the judgment that something else is more important than fear."
Andy Rooney - "Everyone wants to live on top of the mountain, but all the happiness and growth occurs while you're climbing it."
Anonymous (often attributed to Einstein) - "Insanity is doing the same thing over and over and expecting different results."
Antoine de Saint-Exupéry - "If you want to build a ship, don't drum up the people to gather wood, divide the work, and give orders. Instead, teach them to yearn for the vast and endless sea."
Antoine de Saint-Exupéry - "Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away."
Aristotle - "Courage is the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees the others."
Aristotle - "A friend to all is a friend to none."
Aristotle - "We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit."
Aristotle - "Happiness depends upon ourselves."
Benjamin Franklin - "Well done is better than well said."
Benjamin Franklin - "An investment in knowledge pays the best interest."
Benjamin Franklin - "It is no shame to not know, but it is a shame to not want to learn."
Benjamin Franklin - "Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn."
Blaise Pascal - "Man is but a reed, the most feeble thing in nature, but he is a thinking reed."
Blaise Pascal - "The heart has its reasons, which reason does not know."
Buddha - "Our mind is everything. What we think, we become."
Buddha - "There is no path to happiness. Happiness is the path."
Buddha - "A thousand candles can be lit from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared."
Charles Darwin - "A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life."
Epictetus - "Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants."
Epictetus - "We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak."
Epictetus - "First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do."
Epictetus - "It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters."
Friedrich Nietzsche - "And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music."
Friedrich Nietzsche - "He who fights with monsters should be careful lest he thereby become a monster."
Friedrich Nietzsche - "That which does not kill me makes me stronger."
Friedrich Nietzsche - "Without music, life would be a mistake."
Galileo Galilei - "The greatest wisdom is to know oneself."
Henri Poincaré - "To doubt everything or to believe everything are two equally convenient solutions; both dispense with the necessity of reflection."
Henry David Thoreau - "To be a philosopher is not merely to have subtle thoughts, but to so love wisdom as to live according to its dictates, a life of simplicity, independence, and trust."
Henry David Thoreau - "Happiness is like a butterfly; the more you chase it, the more it will elude you, but if you turn your attention to other things, it will come and sit softly on your shoulder."
Henry David Thoreau - "What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us."
Henry Ford - "Whether you think you can, or you think you can't ? you're right."
Henry Ford - "Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently."
Heraclitus - "Character is destiny."
Heraclitus - "The only constant in life is change."
Heraclitus - "You cannot step into the same river twice."
Immanuel Kant - "Two things fill the mind with ever new and increasing admiration and awe: the starry heavens above me and the moral law within me."
Immanuel Kant - "Act in such a way that you treat humanity, whether in your own person or in the person of any other, never merely as a means to an end, but always at the same time as an end."
Jean-Paul Sartre - "Man is condemned to be free."
Jean-Paul Sartre - "Hell is other people."
Jean-Paul Sartre - "Freedom is what you do with what's been done to you."
Jean-Paul Sartre - "Life begins on the other side of despair."
John Lennon - "Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans."
Confucius - "It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop."
Confucius - "Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life."
Confucius - "Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it."
Confucius - "Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated."
Lao Tzu - "The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step."
Lao Tzu - "Silence is a source of great strength."
Lao Tzu - "Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished."
Lao Tzu - "He who knows others is wise. He who knows himself is enlightened."
Ludwig Wittgenstein - "The limits of my language mean the limits of my world."
Ludwig Wittgenstein - "Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent."
Marcus Aurelius - "You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength."
Marcus Aurelius - "The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injustice."
Marcus Aurelius - "Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight."
Marcus Aurelius - "Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking."
Mark Twain - "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do."
Plato - "Music gives a soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination."
Plato - "Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something."
Plato - "Never discourage anyone who continually makes progress, no matter how slow."
Plato - "An empty vessel makes the loudest sound."
Plato - "The beginning is the most important part of the work."
Ralph Waldo Emerson - "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment."
Ralph Waldo Emerson - "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness."
Ralph Waldo Emerson - "Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm."
Ralph Waldo Emerson - "Life is a journey, not a destination."
René Descartes - "I think, therefore I am."
Ryan Holiday (from Stoicism) - "Ego is the enemy."
Ryan Holiday (from Stoicism) - "The obstacle is the way."
Seneca - "Every new chapter in life requires an old version of you to die."
Seneca - "While we are postponing, life speeds by."
Seneca - "It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor."
Seneca - "Fate leads the willing, and drags along the reluctant."
Seneca - "Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity."
Simone de Beauvoir - "One is not born, but rather becomes, a woman."
Simone de Beauvoir - "Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay."
Socrates - "The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing."
Socrates - "People are like clay. They can be shaped and molded, but in the end, they must be fired in the kiln of life to become strong."
Socrates - "The unexamined life is not worth living."
Socrates - "Know thyself."
Voltaire - "I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it."
Voltaire - "Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers."
Voltaire - "The secret of being a bore is to tell everything."
Voltaire - "Common sense is not so common."
